intro: Hyrtanandra gracilis, commonly known as the slender hyrtanandra, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Hyrtanandra gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments within the island's humid forests.
